item.title: About Eric Peña
item.description: Photo Credit: Samuel Sung Hi, I’m Eric! I’ve studied physics, computer science, machine learning, and complex systems modeling. About Me Data Scientist interested in Complex Systems M.S. in Complex Systems Science as a Clifford D. Clark Diversity Fellow at the State University of New York at Binghamton and studied machine learning and complex systems modeling. B.S. in Engineering Physics as a Young Scholar at The Ohio State University. Talks, Publications, and Posters Conference on Artificial Life (ALIFE) 2022 (talk) Life Worth Mentioning Wolfram Demonstration Project 2022 (demonstration) Cellular Automata with Modified Game-of-Life Rules Artificial Life Journal 2021 (publication) Life Worth Mentioning: Complexity of Life-Like Cellular Automata Conference on Complex Systems (CCS) 2021 (talk) Life Worth Mentioning Norteast Regional Conference on Complex Systems (NERCCS) 2021 (talk) Complexity in Conway’s Game of Life and other Life-Like Cellular Automata (poster) Bayesian Sparse Network Reconstruction Norteast Regional Conference on Complex Systems (NERCCS) 2020 (poster) Cellular Automata Optimization using Genetic Algorithms Experience Data Scientist, Motional Statistics and Probability Teacher, SUNY Binghamton Revenue Management Senior Data Analyst, Diageo Math and Physics Tutor, Self-Employed Engineer, H.
